qas.question: What were 2 former Northwestern basketball players charged and convicted for in 1998?
What did federal prosecutors indict four former players for in a separate betting scandal?

answers.text: perjury related to betting on their own games

qas.question: What did an autopsy reveal was in Rashidi Wheeler's system after he died during a practice?
In 2006, what prompted the women's soccer team coach, Jenny Haigh,  to resign?

answers.text: the release of images of alleged hazing

qas.question: After the death of Rashidi Wheeler in 2001, which athletic programs were investigated for stimulants and other banned substances?
What were 2 former Northwestern soccer players charged and convicted for in 1998?

plausible_answers.text: perjury related to betting on their own games

qas.question: What did federal prosecutors indict eight former players for in a separate betting scandal?
What did an autopsy reveal was in Rashidi Wheeler's system after he died during a game?

plausible_answers.text: release of images of alleged hazing

qas.question: In 2006, what prompted the women's football team coach, Jenny Haigh, to resign?
After the death of Rashidi Wheeler in 2010, which athletic programs were investigated for stimulants and other banned substances?

context: In 1998, two former Northwestern basketball players were charged and convicted for <a0_0><b5_0>sports bribery<b5_0/><a0_0/> as a result of being paid to shave points in games against three other Big Ten schools during the 1995 season. The football team became embroiled in a different betting scandal later that year when federal prosecutors indicted four former players for <a1_0><b6_0>perjury related to betting on their own games<b6_0/><a1_0/>. In August 2001, Rashidi Wheeler, a senior safety, collapsed and died during practice from an asthma attack. An autopsy revealed that he had <a2_0><b7_0>ephedrine<b7_0/><a2_0/>, a stimulant banned by the NCAA, in his system, which prompted Northwestern to investigate the prevalence of stimulants and other banned substances across <a4_0><b9_0>all<b9_0/><a4_0/> of its athletic programs. In 2006, the Northwestern women's soccer team was suspended and coach Jenny Haigh resigned following <a3_0>the <b8_0>release of images of alleged hazing<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
